analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is MIXED with bearish structural headwinds outweighing bullish rotation narratives. Conviction is MEDIUM - sources acknowledge both near-term tactical bounce potential and underlying fundamental weakness.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) International equity rotation and precious metals momentum as capital flows away from underperforming US speculative assets; (2) Earnings disappointment risk in fintech and enterprise software creating gap between macro tailwinds and micro corporate guidance; (3) Geopolitical tail-risk (escalation rhetoric, policy uncertainty) as asymmetric threat to risk-on positioning; (4) Bifurcated market behavior with consolidation more likely than sustained directional conviction.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active hedging 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant 7.3% away). Max Pain $686. Near support: $670 (45k OI - active 2.9% away), $645 (126k OI - dormant 6.6% away). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - active 1.0% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant 5.4% away). Max Pain $621. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI - active 2.6% away), $625 (29k OI - active 0.2% away). Both ETFs show bullish support bias with active hedging clustered near current prices.
key_themes: Earnings disappointment risk in fintech and enterprise software
International equity and precious metals rotation
Policy uncertainty and regulatory tightening headwinds
Speculative asset class deterioration and low conviction
risk_factors: Corporate guidance misses spreading sector-wide despite Fed tailwinds
Geopolitical escalation (Iran rhetoric, Taiwan, Russia-Ukraine) triggering rapid risk-off
Banking sector support breaks confirming broader market stress and structural weakness
Retail demand weakness proving structural rather than transitory, impacting discretionary valuations
Treasury market stress (delivery failures at 8-year highs) signaling underlying liquidity/confidence concerns
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Resistance at $700 (active call wall, high OI), support at $670 (active put wall, 2.9% away). QQQ: Resistance at $630-$625 (active call walls clustered <1% away), support at $590 (dormant, 5.4% away). Watch for dealer hedging activation at call walls as primary driver of intraday movement. Max Pain gravitational pull: SPY $686, QQQ $621.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY 1-5 day outlook: Resistance at $700, $750 (dormant 8.6% away). Support holds at $670 (active), with breakdown risk to $645 (dormant 6.6% away) if structure breaks. Max Pain $686 suggests oscillation range. QQQ: Resistance $630-$640 (active cluster), support $590 (dormant 5.4% away). Bias toward lower lows before sustainable recovery per Twitter bearish thesis (bearish higher timeframe trends intact, below yearly opening levels). Expect consolidation with tactical bounces rather than sustained rallies.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
